@graph.name: Dinner, then Dessert
@graph.description: Chef approved recipes for dinners and desserts.

@graph.name: Panda Express Orange Chicken (Copycat) - Dinner, then Dessert
@graph.description: Tender chicken thighs fried crisp and tossed in a magical perfect-copycat Panda Express Orange Chicken Sauce! You'll save a fortune and skip the lines!

@graph.name: Sabrina Snyder
@graph.description: Sabrina is a professionally trained Private Chef of over 10 years with ServSafe Manager certification in food safety. She creates all the recipes here on Dinner, then Dessert, fueled in no small part by her love for bacon. Sabrina Snyder is a professionally trained personal and private chef of over 10 years who is the creator and developer of all the recipes on Dinner, then Dessert. She is also the author of the upcoming cookbook: Dinner, then Dessert – Satisfying Meals Using Only 3, 5 or 7 Ingredients which is being published by Harper Collins. She started Dinner, then Dessert as a business in her office as a lunch service for her coworkers who admired her lunches before going to culinary school and becoming a full time personal chef and private chef. As a personal chef Sabrina would cook for families one day a week and cook their entire week of dinners. All grocery shopping, cooking and cleaning was done along with instructions on reheating. As a private chef she cooked for private parties and cooked in family homes in the evenings for families on a nightly basis after working as a personal chef during the day. Sabrina has been certified as a ServSafe Manager since 2007 and was a longstanding member of the USPCA Personal Chef Association including being on the board of the Washington DC Chapter of Chefs in the US Personal Chef Association when they won Chapter of the year. As a member of the community of food website creators Sabrina Snyder has spoken at many conferences regarding her experiences as a food writer including the Indulge Food Conference, Everything Food Conference, Haven Food Conference and IACP Annual Food Professionals Conference. Sabrina lives with her family in sunny California.

@graph.name: Panda Express Orange Chicken
@graph.description: Panda Express Orange Chicken with tender chicken thighs fried crisp and tossed in a magical perfect-copycat sauce!

video.name: Panda Express Orange Chicken
video.description: The BEST EVER Panda Express Orange Chicken Copycat recipe, made at home!

recipeIngredient: 2 lb boneless (skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1" pieces)
2 tbsp oil (divided, plus more for frying)

recipeInstructions.text: To make the sauce combine the 1 tablespoon cornstarch, rice wine, water, sesame oil, soy sauce, sugar, white vinegar and orange zest.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the sauce combine the 1 tablespoon cornstarch, rice wine, water, sesame oil, soy sauce, sugar, white vinegar and orange zest.

recipeInstructions.text: To coat the chicken add the egg, salt, pepper and 1 tablespoon oil into a bowl and whisk together in a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: To coat the chicken add the egg, salt, pepper and 1 tablespoon oil into a bowl and whisk together in a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: In a separate bowl, add 1/2 cup corn starch and flour and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a separate bowl, add 1/2 cup corn starch and flour and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large frying pan or a wok, heat oil in a wok 375 degrees.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large frying pan or a wok, heat oil in a wok 375 degrees.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip chicken pieces in the egg mixture, then dredge in the flour mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip chicken pieces in the egg mixture, then dredge in the flour mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Fry the chicken for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden and crisp.
recipeInstructions.name: Fry the chicken for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden and crisp.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to a cooling rack and repeat with remaining chicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer to a cooling rack and repeat with remaining chicken.

recipeInstructions.text: When you are done with the chicken, drain most of the oil from the pan (leave about a tablespoon).
recipeInstructions.name: When you are done with the chicken, drain most of the oil from the pan (leave about a tablespoon).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the ginger, garlic and crushed red peppers, cooking for about 10 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the ginger, garlic and crushed red peppers, cooking for about 10 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the orange sauce and bring to boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the orange sauce and bring to boil.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn off the heat, and add cooked chicken and stir until well mixed.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn off the heat, and add cooked chicken and stir until well mixed.
